00091 #include "log_functions.h"

00123 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_access_sw( cache_entry_t           * pentry, 
00124                                             fsal_accessflags_t        access_type,
00125                                             hash_table_t            * ht,
00126                                             cache_inode_client_t    * pclient,
00127                                             fsal_op_context_t       * pcontext, 
00128                                             cache_inode_status_t    * pstatus,
00129                                             int                       use_mutex ) 
00130 {
00131   fsal_attrib_list_t   attr ;
00132   fsal_status_t        fsal_status ;
00133   cache_inode_status_t cache_status ;
00134   fsal_accessflags_t   used_access_type ;
00135   fsal_handle_t *      pfsal_handle = NULL ;
00136   
00137   /* Set the return default to CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS */
00138   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00139 
00140   /* stats */
00141   pclient->stat.nb_call_total += 1 ;  
00142   pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_call[CACHE_INODE_ACCESS] += 1 ;
00143   
00144   if( use_mutex )
00145     P( pentry->lock ) ;
00146 
00147   /* We do no explicit access test in FSAL for FSAL_F_OK: it is considered that if 
00148    * an entry resides in the cache_inode, then a FSAL_getattrs was successfully made
00149    * to populate the cache entry, this means that the entry exists. For this reason, 
00150    * F_OK is managed internally */
00151   if( access_type != FSAL_F_OK )
00152     {
00153       /* We get ride of F_OK */
00154       used_access_type = access_type & ~FSAL_F_OK ;
00155       
00156       
00157       /* We get the attributes */
00158       cache_inode_get_attributes( pentry, &attr ) ;
00159       
00160       /* Function FSAL_test_access is used instead of FSAL_access. This allow
00161        * to take benefit of the previously cached attributes. This behavior
00162        * is configurable via the configuration file. */
00163       
00164       if( pclient->use_test_access == 1 )
00165         {
00166           /* We get the attributes */
00167           cache_inode_get_attributes( pentry, &attr ) ;
00168 
00169           fsal_status = FSAL_test_access( pcontext, used_access_type, &attr ) ;
00170         }
00171       else
00172         {
00173           if( ( pfsal_handle = cache_inode_get_fsal_handle( pentry, pstatus ) ) == NULL )
00174             {
00175               if( use_mutex ) 
00176                 V( pentry->lock ) ;
00177               return *pstatus ;
00178             }
00179           
00180           fsal_status = FSAL_access( pfsal_handle, pcontext, used_access_type, &attr ) ;
00181         }
00182          
00183       if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) )  
00184         {
00185           *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00186           pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_retryable[CACHE_INODE_ACCESS] += 1 ;
00187 
00188           if( fsal_status.major == ERR_FSAL_STALE )
00189            {
00190                 cache_inode_status_t kill_status ;
00191 
00192                 DisplayLog( "cache_inode_access: Stale FSAL File Handle detected for pentry = %p", pentry ) ;
00193 
00194                 
00195                 if( cache_inode_kill_entry( pentry, ht, pclient, &kill_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00196                     DisplayLog( "cache_inode_access: Could not kill entry %p, status = %u", pentry, kill_status ) ;
00197         
00198                 *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ESTALE ;
00199         
00200                 return *pstatus ;
00201            }
00202         }
00203       else
00204         *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00205       
00206     }
00207   
00208   if( *pstatus !=  CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ) 
00209    {
00210      if( use_mutex )
00211        V( pentry->lock ) ;
00212 
00213      return *pstatus ;
00214    } 
00215   /* stats and validation */
00216   if( ( cache_status = cache_inode_valid( pentry, CACHE_INODE_OP_GET, pclient ) ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00217     pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_retryable[CACHE_INODE_ACCESS] += 1 ;
00218   else
00219     pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_success[CACHE_INODE_ACCESS] += 1 ;
00220 
00221   if( use_mutex )
00222     V( pentry->lock ) ;
00223 
00224    return *pstatus ;
00225 } /* cache_inode_access_sw */
00226 
00244 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_access_no_mutex( cache_entry_t           * pentry, 
00245                                                   fsal_accessflags_t        access_type,
00246                                                   hash_table_t            * ht,
00247                                                   cache_inode_client_t    * pclient,
00248                                                   fsal_op_context_t             * pcontext, 
00249                                                   cache_inode_status_t    * pstatus ) 
00250 {
00251   return  cache_inode_access_sw( pentry,
00252                                  access_type, 
00253                                  ht,
00254                                  pclient,
00255                                  pcontext, 
00256                                  pstatus, 
00257                                  FALSE ) ;
00258 } /* cache_inode_access_no_mutex */
00259 
00277 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_access( cache_entry_t           * pentry, 
00278                                          fsal_accessflags_t        access_type,
00279                                          hash_table_t            * ht,
00280                                          cache_inode_client_t    * pclient,
00281                                          fsal_op_context_t             * pcontext, 
00282                                          cache_inode_status_t    * pstatus ) 
00283 {
00284   return  cache_inode_access_sw( pentry,
00285                                  access_type, 
00286                                  ht,
00287                                  pclient,
00288                                  pcontext, 
00289                                  pstatus, 
00290                                  TRUE ) ;
00291 } /* cache_inode_access */
